intro: Lasiandra tibuchina, commonly known as the Tibetan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet or blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and somewhat woody. Lasiandra tibuchina is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
